ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: KAUSHALYA Foundation has started its activities in October 2007 and is registered as Public Charitable Trust under Indian Registration Act at Patna. KAUSHALYA foundation focuses on mobilizing and organizing informal and fragmented vegetable sector (resource poor vegetable growers, vegetable vendors, and farm laborers) of Bihar. The goal of the foundation is to create opportunities of gainful and dignified self-employment for the families dependent on agriculture sector, especially disadvantaged sections (Farmers, farm labourers, agriculture produce vendors and many others), ensuring sustainable livelihood, enriched environment, improved quality of life and good human values. We have been working towards professionalizing vegetable street vendors and marginal growers, and empowering them to face the future challenges in the new global economy, and thus creating wealth and prosperity from farm gate to food plate through undertaking the holistic view of vegetable supply chain under our project Samriddhii. Attractive partnerships have been formed between the farmers and the vendors with a focus on shared interests and mutual growth. To maintain product integrity from source to the customer, the organisation has established a totally integrated supply chain and services bundle which connects and maintains the flow of goods from the source (growers) to customer (road-side vendors, organized retail, food service and hospitality industry). Key benefits of the model include waste reduction (quantity and time), shelf-life extension and cost reduction of agri-produce from hinterlands and upcountry sources to the markets. Accomplishments of KAUSHALYA foundation till date are: â€¢ Mobilized and registered 540 vegetable vendors (Most of them are women) in Patna. â€¢ Established the vegetable supply chain network. The foundation procures directly from the farmers and sells it through the registered vendors in the city. The foundation has 3 collection centres in Bihar which is operated under bare minimum infrastructure. â€¢ Mobilized and organized approximately 675 farmers in two districts Patna and Nalanda. â€¢ The daily throughput of vegetables through the newly established network is about 8-10 ton. â€¢ Developed an improved branded Pushcart â€“ â€œSamriddhii fresh cartâ€. The new improved pushcart will enable the vendors to compete with the best in the market (organized retailers). It has opened a new source of revenue for them in form of advertisements and promotions through the pushcart. The new modified pushcart has the space of approximately 40 sq. ft. (20 sq. ft. is with back light) where advertisements of any company can be put. It will fetch very lucrative price from the advertisers. â€¢ The organisation has successfully executed an innovative marketing and promotional schemes to increase the sale of vegetables.

ngoList.title: Magadh Educational Trust
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Magadh Educational Trust has been set up as a Trust under The Trust Act, with its Registered Office at New Area, Nutan Nagar, Gaya. The specific aim and objective of the Trust is to promote world-class education in Bihar and India as a whole. The Trust has been promoted by a group of like-minded individuals coming from diverse background but united with a common thread to attain the aims and objectives of the Trust. The Magadh Educational Trust has been conducting various activities for the societal concern and improving the lives of poor people in dire need and living in remote rural areas affected by naxals. The Trust is also taking initiative in promoting Indian Classical Music by organizing concerts in school and society where eminent musicians are invited to teach the nuances of music to students and also enthrall the music lovers with their soulful music. The society has also been promoting the need of environmental concerns by organizing various activities like sapling plantation, cleanliness campaign and teaching the people of nearby rural areas of the need of hygiene and safe drinking water. The Trust organizes camps in such areas where it distributes freely books, stationeries and cloths to children and people.

Responding to issues of violence against women is difficult because of the mindsets, biases and non-co-operative societal attitudes towards this issue. The cases of atrocities on women are seldom reported because people fear that it would only bring dishonor to the family. In situations where the matter gets reported, the possibility of getting justice remains dismal. This is because, like other forms of oppression VAW is also a systemic violation of women’s rights and dignity.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: CDK is one of the successful activities of organization. Butterflies supports strengthen the activities of CDK.

CHILDLINE India Foundation (CIF) is the nodal agency of the Union Ministry of Women and Child Development acting as the parent organisation for setting up, managing and monitoring the CHILDLINE 1098 service all over the country. Mahila Development Centre is providing services in Muraul, Bandra and Sakra blocks of Muzaffarpur district as a Sub Centre Organization.

MDC is working with CBCI-CARD on TB control and prevention in Muzaffarpur district under Axshya Project the Global Fund Round 9 TB Project. Organization is functioning as bridge between the health system and the community. Encourage and assist the patients in early diagnosis and initiation of treatment and provide necessary support for completing the treatment has been done.

Mahila Development Centre is implementing The Freedom Fund India Programme in special communities (red light areas) of Muzaffarpur, Bettiah and Sitamarhi against sexual slavery with kind support from The Freedom Fund and Geneva Global. Program has empowered to sex workers, it provided safety to children of commercial sex workers from exploitation and abuse and to open the way of rehabilitation and mainstreaming for adolescent girls and boys of special communities.

Mahila Development Centre has CDK in Muzaffarpur, Purnea and Bettiah (West Champaran) districts. CDK’s primary objective is to impart life skills education, teach them to be responsible, prioritise needs, budget and save. Children between the age group of 9-18 years are the members, volunteer managers and promoters of CDK.

CHILDLINE India Foundation (CIF) is the nodal agency of the Union Ministry of Women and Child Development acting as the parent organisation for setting up, managing and monitoring the CHILDLINE 1098 service all over the country. CIF is the sole agency/body responsible for establishing the CHILDLINE service in the cities/districts of the country, monitoring of service delivery and finance, training, research and documentation, creating awareness, advocacy as well as resource generation.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Mahila Sewak Samaj (MSS) was established in 1981 when communal riots broke out in Bihar Sharif. There was a lot of panic and the worst sufferers of the whole episode were women of the minority community. So, MSS was formed by a group of women with the idea to rehabilitate these women, and later on, we started providing skill training to poor women for their live.
